title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 441.339 - Visit
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 441.339 - Visit

State Regulations

The physical appearance of an outpatient at a hospital
complex is recognized as contributing one visit regardless of the number of
diagnostic and/or therapeutic services the patient receives or the number of
sections (clinics), operating rooms, laboratories and treatment areas in which
he/she receives them. The classification of the visit (i.e., emergency, clinic, etc.) will be determined by the first location where service is rendered. A
patient referred from a physician's office exclusively for a specific ancillary
service or services is classified as one referred ambulatory visit. A
laboratory examination of a specimen sent in by a physician for his/her patient
shall be included as one referred ambulatory visit. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
ยง
441.339

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
